ud4.2:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying in the sal forest of the Mallas at Upavattana near Kusinārā.
ud4.2:1.3: Now at that time several mendicants were staying not far from the Buddha in a wilderness hut. They were restless, insolent, fickle, scurrilous, loose-tongued, unmindful, lacking situational awareness and immersion, with straying minds and undisciplined faculties.
ud4.2:2.1: The Buddha saw those mendicants staying nearby.
ud4.2:3.1: Then, understanding this matter, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ud4.2:5.1: That’s why you should guard the mind,
ud4.2:5.3: and right view at the fore.
ud4.2:5.5: a mendicant who has overcome <j>dullness and drowsiness
